title: Ethereum Uncovered: How It Works, Why It Matters, and Where It’s Headed
keyQuestions: What makes Ethereum different from Bitcoin and other blockchains?
How do smart contracts and dApps work in simple terms?
What changed with the move from Proof-of-Work to Proof-of-Stake?
How is Ethereum used today in DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and gaming?
What are Ethereum’s main challenges and what improvements are coming next?
quickSteps: Understand the core idea: Ethereum is programmable money and apps, not just a coin.
Learn smart-contract basics: code executes rules automatically without middlemen.
Know how PoS works: validators stake ETH and secure the network.
Explore real use cases: DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, identity, and games.
Watch the roadmap: Layer-2 scaling, better UX, and ongoing protocol upgrades.

issueRouting.start: If you’re new to Ethereum, start by choosing what you want to do: hold, use apps, or build.

branches.if: You want to use Ethereum apps (DeFi, NFTs, gaming)
then: Use verified links and official app domains before connecting a wallet.
Start with small test transactions to learn fees and confirmations.
Keep approvals limited and review permissions regularly.

branches.if: You want to hold ETH longer-term
then: Use a wallet you control and back up recovery information safely.
Avoid keeping large balances on exchanges for long periods.
Consider a hardware wallet if your holdings justify it.

riskNotes: Fee volatility: Ethereum mainnet fees can spike during congestion; Layer-2s help.
Smart-contract risk: bugs or malicious contracts can cause losses even if the chain is secure.
Phishing risk: fake dApps and wallet prompts are a common attack vector.
Regulatory and market risk: policy changes and cycles can impact access and demand.
